exceptions.exn: Cannot coerce wmonotonic to an evaluable reference.

In environment A : Type X, Y : Type TX : reduction_t A X TY : reduction_t A Y F, G : function X X HF : wmonotonic TX TX F HG : wmonotonic TX TX G L : relation Y HL : simulation TY TY L Unable to unify "wmonotonic ?M1511 ?M1512 (Union ?M1514)" with "wmonotonic TY TX (chaining_l L)".

In environment A : Type X, Y : Type TX : reduction_t A X TY : reduction_t A Y F, G : function X X HF : wmonotonic TX TX F HG : wmonotonic TX TX G L : relation Y HL : simulation TY TY L Unable to unify "monotonic ?M1512 ?M1513 (chaining_l ?M1514)" with "wmonotonic TY TX (chaining_l L)".

In environment A : Type X, Y : Type TX : reduction_t A X TY : reduction_t A Y F, G : function X X HF : wmonotonic TX TX F HG : wmonotonic TX TX G L : relation Y HL : simulation TY TY L The term "TY" has type "Lbl A -> relation Y" while it is expected to have type "Lbl A -> Y -> Prop" (cannot unify "Y -> Prop" and "Prop").

original: unfold wmonotonic, chaining_l. intros. apply Union_wmon. - apply chaining_l_mon. apply simulation_eeq with TY. + unfold eeq. intros. split. apply H, HL. apply H0, HL. + apply HL. - apply HF. - apply HG.
